messages.message: @Ashish do you know if we upgraded tensorflow because of security issues? it's causing pip dependency conflicts :disappointed: probably too bleeding edge
i searched https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/search/results?form_type=Basic&results_type=overview&query=tensorflow&search_type=all and seems like 1.13.1 is ok?
Hi Lydia, here is the PR for the upgrade https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/11024
It is strangely marked as low priority for Ubuntu however our scans picked it up as a high (cc @will)
oh i was talking about tensorflow -- then there's no reason we upgraded it to 1.14.0?
it's causing some conflicts in dep versions with spacy since our spacy version is much older
I can take a look on Monday, but I fear the answer might be “we need to upgrade the cascading dependencies”.
The good news is pip-compile can help
for context, I was trying to build a new py2 docker image and was getting python version must be greater than 3.5 errors, so I wanted to pin all our packages to avoid any unknown upgrades
but when i tried to pip-compile the image-tasks deps, i got some conflicts, mainly with tensorflow and other ML packages
@will it's late on the east coast but i'm basically trying to do your image-tasks pip PR. i'm just starting from scratch since a lot of packages have been updated since you opened the PR in aug
https://github.com/jazzband/pip-tools/blob/master/README.rst#updating-requirements pip-compile will help resolve that type of thing if you specify the package(s) you are trying to bump
Sorry I am not more helpful, on mobile ATM
no worries - if we are ok with downgrading tensorflow to 1.13.1 it solves my issues
I can be at a laptop in an a couple of hours if we need to resolve this tonight. :)
let's see what ashish says. i'm just trying to make sure our docker containers build on monday for the push :stuck_out_tongue:
